required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genitourinary Symptoms With Levonorgestrel Releasing Intrauterine Systems
clinical_study.official_title: Genitourinary Symptoms in Women Using Levonorgestrel Releasing Intrauterine Systems

lead_sponsor.agency: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bakirkoy Dr. Sadi Konuk Research and Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of the study was to evaluate the efficacy of Levonorgestrel Releasing Intrauterine devices (LNR-IUD) on genitourinary symptoms in patients with abnormal uterine bleeding. The patients were asked urogenital distress inventory (UDI) (which includes; irritative symptoms, stress symptoms, obstructive discomfort) and incontinence impact questionnaire (IIQ) (which includes; physical activity, travel, social/relationships, emotional health)questionnaires in the day of application LNR-IUD and six months later this procedure. Statistical analyse will be performed to evaluate the changes in this time period.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: We think that the urinary frequency will be lesser after 6 months of the therapy.

secondary_outcome.description: We think that social activity will be better after reducing urinary symptoms

study_pop.textblock: 15-55 aged women using levonorgestrel releasing intrauterine device for the treatment of menorrhagia or adenomyosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women using levonorgestrel releasing intrauterine device for the treatment of menorrhagia or adenomyosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
